1:
Yahweh, you have examined me, and you know me.
\q
2:
You know when I sit down and when I get up;
\q you understand my thoughts from far away.
4:
For before there is a word on my tongue,
\q you know it completely, Yahweh.
\q
5:
Behind me and before me you surround me
\q and place your hand upon me.
\q
6:
Such knowledge is too much for me;
\q it is too high, and I cannot reach it.
7:
Where can I go from your Spirit?
\q Where can I flee from your presence?
\q
8:
If I ascend up to the heavens, you are there;
\q if I make my bed in Sheol, behold, you are there.
9:
If I fly away on the wings of the morning
\q and go to live in the uttermost parts across the sea,
\q
10:
even there your hand will lead me,
\q your right hand will hold on to me.
11:
If I said, "Surely the darkness will cover me,
\q and the light will become night around me,"
\q
12:
even the darkness would not be dark to you.
\q The night would shine like the day,
\q for the darkness and the light are both alike to you.
14:
I will praise you,
\q for I am wonderfully made.
\q My soul knows this very well.
15:
My bones were not hidden from you
\q when I was made in private,
\q when I was intricately made in the depths of the earth.
\q
16:
You saw me inside the womb;
\q all the days assigned to me were recorded
\q in your book even before the first one happened.
\q
17:
How precious are your thoughts to me, God!
\q How vast is their sum!
\q
18:
If I tried to count them, they would be more in number than the sand.
\q When I awake, I am still with you.
20:
They rebel against you and act deceitfully;
\q your enemies tell lies.
21:
Do I not hate those, Yahweh, who hate you?
\q Do I not despise those who rise up against you?
\q
22:
I hate them completely;
\q they have become my enemies.
24:
See if there is any wicked way in me,
\q and lead me in the everlasting way.
139:
\m
\d For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
\q
